bibl.title: Dionysiac Oinophoroi from Sagalassos Found in Egypt.
Egyptian Religion: The Last Thousand Years. Studies Dedicated to the Memory of Jan Quaegebeur. Part I
bibl.author: POBLOME, Jeroen

bibl.note: L'origine de 2 oinophoroi du Musée du Caire, Inv. 54502; 89081 [ed.: Günter GRIMM, Kunst der Ptolemäer- und Römerzeit im Ägyptischen Museum Kairo (Mainz, 1975) p. 28, Nos 76-77 et pll. 116-118], l'une provenant du Fayoum, l'autre de provenance inconnue, IVe siècle p.C.
POBLOME Jeroen, Dionysiac Oinophoroi from Sagalassos Found in Egypt.

Willy CLARYSSE, Antoon SCHOORS and Harco WILLEMS (Edd.), Egyptian Religion: The Last Thousand Years. Studies Dedicated to the Memory of Jan Quaegebeur. Part I = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 84 (Leuven, 1998) pp. 205-225, 11 pll.
